text.0: yonder goes up that light your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven.
text.1: within this car are stored three kindred shares of food and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.
text.2: forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn.
text.3: stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom and spreading through midair bright radiance like the sun.
text.4: drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught harness for the meaths sake the chariot that ye love.
text.5: refresh the way ye go refresh the paths with meath hither o aśvins bring the skin that holds the meath.
text.6: the swans ye have are friendly rich in store of meath goldpinioned strong to draw awake at early morn.
text.7: swimming the flood exultant fain for draughts that cheer ye come like flies to our libations of the meath.
text.8: well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath the fires sing to the morning aśvins at the break of day.
text.9: when with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the soma rich in meath.
text.10: the rays advancing nigh chasing with day the gloom spread through the firmament bright radiance like the sun.
text.11: and the sun harnessing his horses goeth forth ye through your godlike nature let his paths be known.
text.12: devout in thought i have declared o aśvins your chariot with good steeds which lasts for ever.
text.13: wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.
